properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 12 at 3:30PM EST until February 13 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Marquette MI
properties.description:
* WHAT...Lake effect snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow
accumulations of 2 to 7 inches with the greatest over higher
terrain near Lake Superior. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph
will result in extensive blowing snow.

* WHERE...Ontonagon and Gogebic Counties.

* WHEN...From noon EST /11 AM CST/ today to noon EST /11 AM CST/
Thursday.

* IMPACTS...An Arctic front moving through the region will sharply
reduce visibility to near zero at times in snow and blowing
early this afternoon. Hazardous conditions will continue into
the Thursday morning commute. Roads will also become slippery.
Wind chills will drop as low as 20 below zero late tonight into
Thursday morning.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel this afternoon and evening, pack a winter
survival kit and be prepared to slow down as sharp visibility
reductions in snow and blowing snow are expected.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST /11 AM CST/ THURSDAY
